intro: Seretoberlinia seretii, commonly known as the African velvet tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Bombacaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, orange-red flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds covered in a silky, fibrous coating. It is often found in dry savanna and woodland habitats, thriving in regions with seasonal rainfall. The plant has been used traditionally for its fibers, which are used in making ropes and textiles.
